Key Match Events: Jameson Taillon allowed only one run in six innings and the Chicago Cubs beat the New York Yankees 2-1 on Sunday to avoid a series sweep.
I. Paredes singled to center, Bellinger scored and Swanson scored, Tauchman to third.
Volpe hit sacrifice fly to left, Chisholm Jr. scored.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Chicago Cubs beat the AL East-leading Yankees 2-1 to avoid a series sweep.
The game was played at Wrigley Field in Chicago, Illinois, with an attendance of 39,364.
The Cubs' Jameson Taillon pitched six innings, allowing only one run, while Gerrit Cole of the Yankees also pitched six innings, allowing no runs but getting the loss.
